page.title: 06Energy.
page.content: The energy required for cooking our food and heating our homes comes in various guises. The cheapest but most cumbersome is solid fossilised fuel in the form of raw coal or anthracite. This has the disadevantages of polluting the atmosphere and requiring almost constant attention. Fuel oil is more expensive but the system can be made automatic. It also requires no carrying into the house and leaves behind no ash to be cleared away. Gas is comparable in cost and has all the advantges of oil, However it does very occasionally cause an explosion where a fault has gone undetected. The most convenient energy source is electricity but if used for heating, large bills must be expected.
